comment: Best Professor. TAKE HIM FOR DISCRETE MATHS. Makes the material very clear and easy to understand, as well as fun. Gives a good study guide that prepares you well for the tests.

Fell just short of an A but I felt like I deserved an 88. I wasn't upset at all because he challenged me and I felt great about the work I did. He's not the type of professor that's unreasonably hard so he can challenge you. Victor takes time to give you problems to make you think about the overall picture. Victor is an Amazing Professor! REP++++++

Dr. Larsen is an amazing professor. Weekly homework - doable if you understand the lectures. He's a very nice white guy who brings cookies for tests. Four tests, none cumulative. He will challenge you in a good way, just come to class and ask questions if you don't understand. He loves the subject and is happy to help! (Graph Theory)
One of the best professor I have had so far, you will leave the class having learned something because he puts the effort into helping you learn it.

Attend all lectures, lots of valuable info is given during class. Put most of your time into the homework assignments from the start, they are very effective. Go to office hours more than a day before homework is due. Dr. Larsen will help with any questions and he does so without making you feel dumb or inadequate. He's really a great professor.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He's a great teacher the subject is just somewhat difficult. He has office hours which is a must for this class, because he will help you immensely. Make sure you do homework because if you do, it makes the tests a lot easier. Don't miss class or else you'll miss important criteria that you may not completely understand from the book.

The homework he assigns is very relevant to the tests. If you study your mistakes on the homework, you will definitely do well on the exams. He's pretty good about answering questions you email him and he's very available for office hours.

Excellent professor, cares about students and very interested in the material. More than willing to answer any questions you have to help you understand. Homework very helpful and relevant, book choice is excellent, and tests that let you pick which questions to solve and avoid the ones you can't.
